title: Ticket #2004: condor_submit -remote for unknown user
description:
When using CLAIMTOBE and using remote submission to a schedd for a user which is not known to that schedd host, the jobs will get stuck in a limbo state where the shadow continually errors out. 

03/28/11 09:27:09 (180.0) (31122): WriteUserLog::initialize: init_user_ids() failed!
03/28/11 09:27:09 (180.0) (31122): ERROR "Failed to initialize user log to /home/tstclair/work/personal-condor/spool/180/0/cluster180.proc0.subproc0/mrg_180.0.log" at line 777 in file /home/tstclair/work/spaces/ref/git/src/condor_shadow.V6.1/baseshadow.cpp
03/28/11 09:27:09 (180.0) (31122): WriteUserLog: not initialized @ writeEvent()

The expected behavior would be to run as user nobody in this case.

Repro condition:

  1. Login to a windows box as a user not known on a linux submit node
  2. condor_submit -remote schedhost.name your.submit
  3. scan ShadowLog && SchedLog
remarks:
2011-Apr-07 13:17:10 by tstclair:
When attempting to create file(s) as user nobody you get a permission denied error

2011-Apr-11 16:36:24 by danb:
Code review:

"used" --> "user" in the following: 

    dprintf(D_ALWAYS, "trying init_user_ids() as used nobody\n" );

Not sure what the following comment is trying to say: 

    // there is

The following makes me a little nervous: 

    jobAd->Assign( ATTR_OWNER, "UNDEFINED" );

For example, I see the following in the starter code: 

    if( run_as_owner ) {
        if( job_ad->LookupString( ATTR_OWNER, owner ) != 1 ) {
            dprintf( D_ALWAYS, "ERROR: %s not found in JobAd.  Aborting.\n",
                     ATTR_OWNER );
            return false;
        }
    }

Therefore, you should probably force ATTR_JOB_RUNAS_OWNER to false in the job ad.

2011-Apr-11 16:45:09 by tstclair:
Yup, put it up in haste.. modified and will verify functionality

2011-Apr-11 16:53:15 by danb:
Oh, and please add SHADOW_RUN_UNKNOWN_USER_JOBS to the param table if it is not already there.
